message: Why ban guns? It's not the guns that do the shooting it's the mentally ill or confused people who pull the trigger. After guns there are other things, bow and arrows, sledge hammers, box cutters, axes, saws, knives, crowbars, feet and hands, ropes, and etc. It's time to admit that some folks through no fault of their own have mental health and psychological problems. We need tougher mental health screening. What good does it do to ban guns when we all know that the criminals will always find a way to get a gun while the responsible people will be unable to defend themselves. The first line of our defense is ourselves. The 2nd amendment was written so that we could defend ourselves from governments just like the one that we the people are suffering under as well as those individuals that are intent upon causing grave harm to others.

Sony is saying that technology progresses. Is there somehow who actually disagrees with that? Everyone crying tears into a pillow that their PS4v1 might no longer be the top dog of consoles should get a grip. Technology is obsolete before it even hits retailers. How do these sorts of stories yield so many nonsensical replies? The heat comments are garbage, betraying a fundamental misunderstanding of the entire field. GPUs get better. Indeed, one of the biggest improvements lately has been *huge* reductions in the power consumption, and thus heat, of GPUs.
